thread.title: Former UNLV golfers, Las Vegas locals vying for Shriner's Open title
thread.title_full: Former UNLV golfers, Las Vegas locals vying for Shriner's Open title

title: Former UNLV golfers, Las Vegas locals vying for Shriner's Open title
text:
Former UNLV golfers, Las Vegas locals vying for Shriner's Open title Former UNLV golfers, Las Vegas locals vying for Shriner's Open title 
Former UNLV Rebel Chad Campbell will start Sunday‘s final round at the Shriner‘s Hospitals for Children Open just two strokes off leader Brett Stegmaier. Josh Holmberg/Las   By Chris Kudialisreviewjournal.com Former UNLV Rebel Chad Campbell and Summerlin resident Kevin Na (-11) stand just two strokes behind tournament leader Brett Stegmaier (-13) heading into Sunday's final round at the Shriner's Hospitals for Children Open. Bonanza High School graduate Scott Piercy (-8) and Henderson resident Nick Watney (-8) are five strokes back. Review-Journal reporter Chris Kudialis will be blogging all of the action live from TPC Summerlin, featuring commentary from RJ sports writers Steve Carp and Ed Graney.
